title: Help someone learn Python this Christmas – this boot camp training is $20
content:
Macworld

When the days start getting shorter, you’ll be really glad you stocked away a few last-minute gift ideas to help cover all your bases. With that in mind, a course collection like this Python training bundle is a great option for any tech-savvy coders on your list.

These 12 courses, comprising over 130 hours of comprehensive instruction, will help anyone from beginners to seasoned programmers truly understand why Python and its foundational role in progressive domains like artificial intelligence and machine learning will likely make it a much valued skill for decades to come.

In this up-to-the minute collection, learners have the freedom to learn at their own speed, absorbing valuable insights from seasoned Python users and trainers like Musa Arda, a skilled software engineer, Dr. Chris Mall, an expert in computer science, and Jose Salvatierra, a long-time programmer.

The lineup kicks off with a few beginner-friendly courses, including The Complete Python Course: Learn Python by Doing in 2023, Python Programming, CS, Algorithms, and Data Structures, and Python Hands-On. 

As learners progress, the focus shifts towards honing specific Python skills, such as Intro to Coding with Python Turtle, Computer Vision and Deep Learning, and even creating a Smart Security Camera for Raspberry Pi.

Even with a course package this expansive, the Python certification boot camp bundle is anything but a budget buster. Regularly over $80, all this coursework is available now at the holiday-friendly price of just $19.99. And since the entire collection is digital, there’s no shipping needed, so your gift can be ready for giving whenever you need it.
